ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Can drinking alcohol cause chronic pain?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 999= Not Sure/Do Not Know

ElementDescription: Can drinking alcohol make pain worse over time?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 999= Not Sure/Do Not Know

ElementDescription: Can drinking alcohol make it more difficult to function physically despite pain?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 999= Not Sure/Do Not Know

ElementDescription: Can drinking alcohol reduce the effectiveness of opioid medications?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 999= Not Sure/Do Not Know

ElementDescription: Can the experience of pain make people want to drink alcohol or cause them to drink more?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 999= Not Sure/Do Not Know

ElementDescription: Can drinking alcohol directly reduce pain in a way that is similar to opioid medications?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 999= Not Sure/Do Not Know

ElementDescription: Can drinking alcohol help to distract from pain?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 999= Not Sure/Do Not Know

ElementDescription: Can quitting drinking alcohol help to improve pain and physical functioning?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 999= Not Sure/Do Not Know

ElementDescription: Can drinking alcohol while taking prescription opioid medication cause dangerous health effects?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 999= Not Sure/Do Not Know

ElementDescription: Can drinking alcohol slow down the metabolism of opioids and increase the risk of overdose?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 999= Not Sure/Do Not Know
